Blog.post: I just registered www.conordoyle.com. I was surprised that it was available and snatched it up as quick as possible. Look for this blog to move to a new home shortly. After checking the stats, it looks like I'm still talking to myself here. Drop me a line and let me know I'm not. BTW - urlLink Andy Kaufman is apparently alive and well in NYC!

I just posted a new image on my urlLink deviantart page . urlLink This is my oldest daughter, Kayla I posted the image to take part in the urlLink DA-Digital solitude contest on Deviantart. Secondly, I've been testing out my new urlLink gmail account and must say I like it. There are still some bugs that need to be worked out of the system, but the interface is cool, the functionality is revolutionary, and the fact that it is urlLink Google is awesome. Let me know what you think about the image (or images). Conor
I just got a gmail account ( urlLink conor.doyle@gmail.com )! Also check out the greatest webcomic ever - urlLink Something Positive . If you've never been, go. Conor

This is my first official blog post ever. I've never kept a journal or been very good at writing about myself, but we'll give this a shot. Some quick background info on me: Age: 25 Marital Status: Married Children: 2 girls (Kayla and Molly) Pets: 2 Cats I am currently a webmaster/web admin for a company called urlLink Aquascape Designs , out of Batavia, Illinois. We sell equipment for backyard ponds and water gardens. It's a great, growing company and I've been here for 6 years. My current passion is for photography. My website will have a portfolio of pictures. For now you can see them at urlLink my deviantart page . Well that should do it for my initial post. I look forward to being active here. Conor

You may not know what state it is in, but now you will be able to find your way around it. Kudos to these guys who had 'sacrifice' many hours watching and re-watching Simpsons episodes. urlLink Guide to Springfield USA

urlLink CNN.com - Spanky the clown arrested on porn charges It makes me sick to see stuff like this. Makes you want to endorse things like the death penalty, caning, or ritualistic torture. I've currently have 5-6 registered sex offenders living within 4 miles of my house. You can't go anywhere without running into this stuff.

urlLink Wired News : "Before President George W. Bush orders the demolition of Abu Ghraib, he might want to learn how to pronounce the name of the infamous site of the Iraqi prison abuse scandal. During Bush's half-hour television address Monday, he mangled the name of the notorious prison each of the three times he mentioned it, despite having rehearsed the speech twice. To his credit, Abu Ghraib is an easy name to garble. The correct pronunciation sounds like 'ah-BOO grehhb,' with the second word beginning with a guttural, phlegmy 'gh' sound. The pronunciation-impaired president, however, first called the prison 'abugah-rayp.' His second attempt came out 'abu-garon,' and his final utterance sounded something like 'abu-garah.' Too bad Camp Redemption didn't stick. -- Jenny McKeel "
I'm a little behind on this... urlLink Google Search: miserable failure
urlLink 'Spellbound' Star Struggles for Happier Ending (washingtonpost.com)
Randy at urlLink Something Positive has struck again. Possibly the best board game ever has just been released: urlLink something positive: Brandy Land

I spend 40+ hours a week trying to get the website of the company I work for ( urlLink www.aquascapedesigns.com ) to be in the top 10 for our certain keywords. I've, so far, gotten only 1 keyword phrase in the top 50. Now with no effort, and only a few weeks, I've gotten my blog into the number 1 spot in urlLink Google for Conor Doyle . I guess you can't win all the time. :-)
